    Constructor Description

  • Uses of Color in camzup.kotlin

    Subclasses of Color in camzup.kotlin 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  KtClr
    Provides Kotlin operator overloading support for colors.
    Methods in camzup.kotlin with parameters of type Color 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    KtClr KtClr.div​(Color c)
    Returns a new color with the division of the instance by the right operand.
    void KtClr.divAssign​(Color c)
    Divides the instance by the right operand (mutates the color in place).
    KtClr KtClr.minus​(Color c)
    Returns a new color with the subtraction of the right operand from the instance.
    void KtClr.minusAssign​(Color c)
    Subtracts the right operand from the instance (mutates the vector in place).
    KtClr KtClr.plus​(Color c)
    Returns a new color with the addition of the right operand to the instance.
    void KtClr.plusAssign​(Color c)
    Adds the right operand to the instance (mutates the vector in place).
    KtClr KtClr.rem​(Color c)
    Returns a new color with the unsigned remainder (mod) of the instance and the right operand.
    void KtClr.remAssign​(Color c)
    Assigns the unsigned remainder (mod) of the instance and the right operand to the instance (mutates the vector in place).
    KtClr KtClr.times​(Color c)
    Returns a new color with the product of the instance and the right operand.
    void KtClr.timesAssign​(Color c)
    Multiplies the right operand with the instance (mutates the color in place).
